Class ColorManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.ColorManager
public final class ColorManager extends Object
Manages color mapping for game bricks and UI elements.

  • Method Details

    • getFillColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Paint getFillColor(int colorIndex, boolean is1984Mode)
      Maps a color index to a Paint color.
      Parameters:
      colorIndex - The color index (0 = transparent, 1-7 = brick colors)
      is1984Mode - If true, non-transparent colors return WHITE (1984 mode uses white bricks)
      Returns:
      The corresponding Paint color

    • getFillColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Paint getFillColor(int colorIndex)
      Maps a color index to a Paint color (default mode, not 1984).
      Parameters:
      colorIndex - The color index (0 = transparent, 1-7 = brick colors)
      Returns:
      The corresponding Paint color

    • createGhostColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Color createGhostColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color originalColor, double opacity)
      Creates a ghost color with reduced opacity.
      Parameters:
      originalColor - The original color
      opacity - The opacity level (0.0 to 1.0)
      Returns:
      A new Color with the same RGB but adjusted opacity

    • createGhostColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Color createGhostColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color originalColor)
      Creates a ghost color with default ghost opacity.
      Parameters:
      originalColor - The original color
      Returns:
      A new Color with ghost opacity

    • createGhostBorderColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Color createGhostBorderColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color originalColor)
      Creates a ghost border color with default border opacity.
      Parameters:
      originalColor - The original color
      Returns:
      A new Color with ghost border opacity
